Extrude the sketch along the normal direction (i.e., along the Z-axis) by the height of the prism (4 units) minus the depth of the extrusion from Part 1 (0.0625 units). The result should be 3.9375 units. Part 4 (Final Shape) Create the flat top of the prism Create a new coordinate system aligned with the first one, with no rotation or translation. Apply a scale of 0.75 to the 2D sketch. Extrude the sketch along the normal by 0.0 depth and opposite the normal by 0.0094 depth. This will give a final height of 0.0094 and a final shape as described. **Part 2: Rectangular Prism with Flat Top and Bottom** Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Draw the fourth curve, a line, starting at point 0.0, 0.75 and ending at point 0.0, 0.0. This will create the back edge of the rectangle, connecting back to the start point and creating a closed loop. Apply a scale of 0.75 to the 2D sketch. Extrude the sketch along the normal by 0.4687 depth and opposite the normal by 0.0 depth. This will give a final height of 0.4687 and a final shape as described.</description>
